• Org Sustainability Investors Give us your Feedback Sitemap Legal Terms of Service Privacy Information Responsible Disclosure Trust Contact Manage Preferences Strong background in Computer Science, English, Communications, Cyber Security, Engineering Management, or related fieldMust be located in North AmericaExcellent interpersonal and communications skillsExperienced writer/editorAbility to adapt to changing priorities while handling high-volume requests Interest in Cyber SecurityExperience driving communication plans/initiativesAbility to build programs from start to finish that are replicable in the future University Overview Interns New Grads Advanced Degrees Associate Program Manager Drive initiatives for Security including Incident Response, Security Awareness, Security Assurance, Engineering, Product Management, GRC (Governance, Risk and Compliance), Threat Intel, Information Management, and others.

• Create memorable, engaging communications programs to drive awareness of key initiatives and inspire employees to take action.
• Learn to utilize Marketing Cloud, Pardot, Slack, Google Suite, Quip and other creative platforms.

job_title: Engineering Intern - Material Flow (Winter 2026 Co-Op Program)
job_description:
• Must be currently pursuing a bachelors, masters degree at an accredited university in Industrial Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, Supply Chain, Mechanical Engineering, or related field.
• Experience with AutoCAD, Tableau, or simulation software preferred.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
• Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
• Proficient in MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint).
• Familiarity with Lean Manufacturing and material handling principles is a plus.
